Definition: another form for {{h1942}}; ruin; mischief.

from {{h1933}} (in the sense of eagerly coveting and rushing upon; by implication, of falling); desire; also ruin; calamity, iniquity, mischief, mischievous (thing), naughtiness, naughty, noisome, perverse thing, substance, very wickedness.
a form of {{h1938}}; Hodijah, the name of three Israelites; Hodijah.
a form for the feminine of {{h3064}}; a Jewess; Hodiah.
feminine active participle of {{h1984}}; folly; madness.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h1981}}; to go; causatively, to bring; bring again, come, go (up).
a prolonged form of {{h1930}} (akin to {{h188}}); oh!; ah, alas, ho, O, woe.
of uncertain derivation; Hoham, a Canaanitish king; Hoham.
a primitive root (compare {{h2000}}); to make an uproar, or agitate greatly; destroy, move, make a noise, put, ring again.
from active participle of {{h1984}}; folly; madness.
for {{h5092}}; lamentation; woe. (For hiyr. See {{h1931}}, {{h1932}}.)
from an unused root (meaning to shout); acclamation; shout(-ing).
from {{h3467}}; deliverer; Hoshea, the name of five Israelites; Hosea, Hoshea, Oshea.
from {{h3467}} and {{h3050}}; Jah has saved; Hoshajah, the name of two Israelites; Hoshaiah.
from {{h3498}}; he has caused to remain; Hothir, an Israelite; Hothir.
a primitive root (compare {{h2372}}); to dream; sleep.
from {{h2000}}; raging; Homam, an Edomitish chieftain; Homam. Compare {{h1967}}.
a primitive root; properly, to be naught, i.e. (figuratively) to be (causatively, act) light; be ready.
from the same as {{h1951}} in the sense of {{h202}}; wealth; by implication, enough; enough,   for nought, riches, substance, wealth.
from {{h3068}} and {{h8085}}; Jehovah has heard; Hoshama, an Israelite; Hoshama.
a shortened form of {{h162}}; ah! expressing grief; woe worth.
from {{h1924}} and {{h5828}}; Hadar (i.e. Hadad, {{h1908}}) is his help; (i.e. Hadadezer, {{h1909}}); Hadarezer,	a Syrian king; Hadarezer.
a primitive root; to swell up (literally or figuratively, active or passive); by implication, to favor or honour, be high or proud; countenance, crooked place, glorious, honour, put forth.
a primitive root; to push away or down; cast away (out), drive, expel, thrust (away).
(Aramaic) from {{h1922}}; magnificence; honour, majesty.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h1921}}; to magnify (figuratively); glorify, honour.
from {{h1921}}; honour; used (figuratively) for the capital city (Jerusalem); glory.
the same as {{h1926}}; Hadar, an Edomite; Hadar.
feminine of {{h1926}}; decoration; beauty, honour.
from {{h1921}}; magnificence, i.e. ornament or splendor; beauty, comeliness, excellency, glorious, glory, goodly, honour, majesty.
a primitive root (compare {{h1949}}, {{h1993}}); properly, to put in commotion; by implication, to disturb, drive, destroy; break, consume, crush, destroy, discomfit, trouble, vex.
from {{h1935}} and {{h3050}}; majesty of Jah; Hodavjah, the name of three Israelites; Hodaviah.
a form of {{h1938}}; Hodajvah, an Israelite; Hodaiah.
(Aramaic) or (feminine) הִיא; (Aramaic), corresponding to {{h1931}}; × are, it, this.
or הָוָה; a primitive root (compare {{h183}}, {{h1961}}) supposed to mean properly, to breathe; to be (in the sense of existence); be, × have.
by permutation from {{h1929}}; oh!; alas.

of which the feminine (beyond the Pentateuch) is הִיא; he a primitive word, the third person pronoun singular; he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are; he, as for her, him(-self), it, the same, she (herself), such, that (...it), these, they, this, those, which (is), who.
the same as {{h1935}}; Hod, an Israelite; Hod.
a form of {{h1938}}; Hodevah (or Hodevjah), an Israelite; Hodevah.

(Aramaic) or הָוָה; (Aramaic), corresponding to {{h1933}}; to exist; used in a great variety of applications (especially in connection with other words); be, become,   behold,   came (to pass),   cease,   cleave,   consider,   do,   give,   have,   judge,   keep,   labour,   mingle (self),   put,   see,   seek,   set,   slay,   take heed, tremble,   walk,   would.
from an unused root; grandeur (i.e. an imposing form and appearance); beauty, comeliness, excellency, glorious, glory, goodly, honour, majesty.
from {{h1986}}; a hammer (or mallet); hammer.
from the article (see {{h1973}}); hither; here, hither(-(to)), thither.
from {{h1986}}; smiter; Helem, the name of two Israelites; Helem.
a primitive root; to strike down; by implication, to hammer, stamp, conquer, disband; beat (down), break (down), overcome, smite (with the hammer).
from {{h1984}}; praising (namely God); Hillel, an Israelite; Hillel.

a primitive root; to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make a show, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify; (make) boast (self), celebrate, commend, (deal, make), fool(-ish, -ly), glory, give (light), be (make, feign self) mad (against), give in marriage, (sing, be worthy of) praise, rage, renowned, shine.
(Aramaic) from {{h1981}}; properly, a journey, i.e. (by implication) toll on goods at a road; custom.
from {{h1980}}; properly, a journey, i.e. (by implication) a wayfarer; also a flowing; × dropped, traveller.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h1980}} (compare {{h1946}}); to walk; walk.

akin to {{h3212}}; a primitive root; to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively); (all) along, apace, behave (self), come, (on) continually, be conversant, depart,   be eased, enter, exercise (self),   follow, forth, forward, get, go (about, abroad, along, away, forward, on, out, up and down),   greater, grow, be wont to haunt, lead, march, × more and more, move (self), needs, on, pass (away), be at the point, quite, run (along),   send, speedily, spread, still, surely,   tale-bearer,   travel(-ler), walk (abroad, on, to and fro, up and down, to places), wander, wax, (way-) faring man, × be weak, whirl.
(Aramaic) probably of foreign origin; a vizier; counsellor.
for {{h1959}}; a shout; sounding again.
or (prolonged) הַגְרִיאxlit Hagrîʼ corrected to Hagrîyʼ; perhaps patronymically from {{h1904}}; a Hagrite or member of a certain Arabian clan; Hagarene, Hagarite, Haggeri.
of uncertain (perhaps foreign) derivation; Hagar, the mother of Ishmael; Hagar.
of uncertain derivation; perhaps suitable or turning; directly.

intensive from {{h1897}}; a murmuring sound, i.e. a musical notation (probably similar to the modern affettuoso to indicate solemnity of movement); by implication, a machination; device, Higgaion, meditation, solemn sound.
from an unused root akin to {{h1897}}; properly, a murmur, i.e. complaint; meditation, musing.
from {{h1908}} and {{h5828}}; Hadad (is his) help; Hadadezer, a Syrian king; Hadadezer. Compare {{h1928}}.
probably of foreign origin (compare {{h111}}); Hadad, the name of an idol, and of several kings of Edom; Hadad.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h1964}}; palace, temple.
probably from {{h3201}} (in the sense of capacity); a large public building, such as a palace or temple; palace, temple.
another form for {{h1950}}; Hemam, an Idumaean; Hemam.
from {{h1984}} (in the sense of brightness); the morning-star; lucifer.

a primitive root (compare {{h1933}}); to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary); beacon, × altogether, be(-come), accomplished, committed, like), break, cause, come (to pass), do, faint, fall,   follow, happen, × have, last, pertain, quit (one-) self, require, × use.
from the same as {{h1959}}; properly, an acclaim, i.e. a choir of singers; thanksgiving.
another form for {{h349}}; how?; how.
another form for {{h1943}}; ruin; calamity.
probably of Egyptian origin; a hin or liquid measure; hin.
probably from {{h539}}; faithful; Heman, the name of at least two Israelites; Heman.
from {{h1993}}; sound; noise.
or (too fully) הֲמוּלָּה; (Jeremiah 11:16), feminine passive participle of an unused root meaning to rush (as rain with a windy roar); a sound; speech, tumult.
of uncertain derivation; Ham, a region of Palestine; Ham.
from {{h1993}}; abundance, i.e. wealth; any of theirs.

or (prolonged) הֵמָּה; masculine plural from {{h1931}}; they (only used when emphatic); it, like, × (how, so) many (soever, more as) they (be), (the) same, × so, × such, their, them, these, they, those, which, who, whom, withal, ye.

a primitive root (compare {{h1949}}); to make a loud sound (like English 'hum'); by implication, to be in great commotion or tumult, to rage, war, moan, clamor; clamorous, concourse, cry aloud, be disquieted, loud, mourn, be moved, make a noise, rage, roar, sound, be troubled, make in tumult, tumultuous, be in an uproar.
(Aramaic) or (prolonged) הִמּוֹן; (Aramaic), corresponding to {{h1992}}; they; × are, them, those.
or הָמֹן; (Ezekiel 5:7), from {{h1993}}; a noise, tumult, crowd; also disquietude, wealth; abundance, company, many, multitude, multiply, noise, riches, rumbling, sounding, store, tumult.
from {{h1995}} and {{h1463}}; the multitude of Gog; the fanciful name of an emblematic place in Palestine; Hamon-gog.
feminine of {{h1995}}; multitude; , the same as {{h1996}}; Hamonah; Hamonah.
from {{h1908}} and {{h7417}}; Hadad-Rimmon, a place in Palestine; Hadad-rimmon.
a primitive root (compare {{h3034}}); to stretch forth the hand; put.
of foreign origin; Hodu (i.e. Hindustan); India.
or הֲדֹרָם; probably of foreign derivation; Hadoram, a son of Joktan, and the tribe descended from him; Hadoram.
of uncertain derivation; Hiddai, an Israelite; Hiddai.
a primitive root (compare {{h1854}}); to crush with the foot; tread down.
from an unused root meaning to stamp upon; a footstool; (foot-) stool.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to that of {{h1916}}; something stamped to pieces, i.e. a bit; piece.
of uncertain derivation; the myrtle; myrtle (tree).
feminine of {{h1918}}; Hadassah (or Esther); Hadassah.
from the article (see {{h1973}}) and {{h2088}}; this very; this.
another form of {{h1976}}; that; this.
from {{h1984}} (in the sense of rejoicing); a celebration of thanksgiving for harvest; merry, praise.
from {{h1976}}; this or that; side, that, this.
probably denominatively from {{h1973}}; to remove or be remote; cast far off.
from the primitive form of the article (hal); to the distance, i.e. far away; also (of time) thus far; back, beyond, (hence,-) forward, hitherto, thence, forth, yonder.
a primitive root; apparently; to injure; make self strange.
from {{h5234}}; respect, i.e. partiality; shew.
from {{h1980}}; a walk, i.e. (by implication) a step; step.
feminine of {{h1978}}; a walking; by implication, a procession or march, a caravan; company, going, walk, way.
